page.title: 01Martock and Stoke area
page.content: The countryside around Martock and Stoke-sub-Hamdon (Stoke) is mainly farmland. Most of it is permanent pasture land. It is used for cattle and some dairy. The main crops are barley, wheat and sugarbeet. They also make a lot of silage and hay. Martock is a growing village as several new estates have appeared in the last few years. It also has a lot of good amenities such as a fire station, co-op, dentist, library etc. Stoke is not as well equipped as Martock but it has a country park called Ham Hill and plenty of pubs. Ham Hill is a popular walking place and from the top you can see the whole area. There are also a lot of Duchy houses in Stoke (owned by the Prince of Wales). The A303 is a busy road. It separates Stoke from Martock and carries much holiday traffic.
